data.name: Override for Habitica’s username. Will be used for service calls

user.description: Connect your Habitica profile to allow monitoring of your user's profile and tasks. Note that api_id and api_key must be gotten from https://habitica.com/user/settings/api

deprecated_task_entity.title: The Habitica `{task_name}` sensor is deprecated
deprecated_task_entity.description:
The Habitica entity `{entity}` is deprecated and will be removed in `2024.12`.
Please update your automations and scripts to replace the sensor entity with the new todo entity.
When you are done migrating you can disable the entity.

deprecated_sensor_entity.title: The Habitica `{entity_name}` sensor is deprecated
deprecated_sensor_entity.description:
The Habitica entity `{entity}` is deprecated and will be removed in `2024.12`.
Each player can have a maximum of 50 HP, and this maximum cannot be altered, thus the `{entity_name}` sensor serves no purpose.
You can disable the entity.

path.name: [%key:common::config_flow::data::path%]
path.description: Items from API URL in form of an array with method attached at the end. Consult https://habitica.com/apidoc/. Example uses https://habitica.com/apidoc/#api-Task-CreateUserTasks.

args.name: Args
args.description: Any additional JSON or URL parameter arguments. See apidoc mentioned for path. Example uses same API endpoint.
